subgoal: Gather ingredients: bacon or guanciale, pecorino romano or parmesan cheese, eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.
original_subgoals: Gather the ingredients: guanciale (or pancetta), pecorino romano cheese, free-range organic eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.

subgoal: Prepare the meat: chop bacon or guanciale into small pieces or chunks.
original_subgoals: Cut guanciale (or pancetta) into chunks.
Remove the skin from the guanciale and slice it into 1 cm thick pieces. Chop into 0.5 cm chunks.
Cut about half a pound of thick-cut bacon into three-quarter inch pieces.
Chop bacon into small pieces.

subgoal: Cook the meat: render fat from bacon or guanciale in a pan until crispy, optionally adding garlic or olive oil for flavor, then remove garlic and turn off the heat.
original_subgoals: Heat olive oil in a pan and cook the guanciale until it releases fat.
Place the guanciale in a cold pan and turn the heat to medium-high to render the fat. Add a cracked garlic clove to the pan for flavor.
Once the guanciale is golden, remove the garlic from the pan.
Heat a pan over medium heat and add a tiny bit of olive oil (optional).
Add the bacon to the pan and slowly render out the fat until the bacon is crispy.
Once the bacon is crispy, remove some pieces for garnish and drain the rest on a paper towel.
Cook the bacon in a pan until crispy, then turn off the heat and let it cool slightly.

subgoal: Prepare the egg and cheese mixture: separate egg yolks and whisk with whole eggs if using, add grated pecorino romano or parmesan cheese, and season with black pepper.
original_subgoals: In a bowl, beat two egg yolks (for two people) and add grated parmesan or pecorino cheese and abundant pepper.
Crack black peppercorns using a pestle and mortar, then sieve to separate the hotter inner part of the peppercorns for use.
Crack eggs into a bowl and add 20 grams of pecorino romano cheese. Whisk together.
In a bowl, whisk together three whole eggs and two egg yolks.
Separate egg yolks from egg whites and place the yolks in a bowl.
Grate three ounces each of Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese.
Gradually whisk the grated cheese into the egg mixture until smooth.
Grate pecorino romano cheese and add it to the egg yolks.
Add freshly ground black pepper to the egg and cheese mixture to taste.
Add freshly ground black pepper to the egg yolk and cheese mixture.

subgoal: Boil pasta: bring water to a boil, add salt, and cook pasta until al dente, reserving some pasta water before draining.
original_subgoals: Boil water and add salt at a ratio of 10 grams per liter.
Add spaghettoni to the boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Boil water in a pot and add a small amount of salt. Twist the pasta and place it in the boiling water to prevent sticking. Cook for 8 minutes.
Boil about four quarts of water and add a tablespoon of kosher salt.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water until slightly al dente, about 10 minutes.
Boil water in a pot, add salt, and cook spaghetti until al dente.
Reserve some pasta water and drain the spaghetti.
Reserve some pasta water before draining the spaghetti.

subgoal: Combine pasta with meat: transfer cooked pasta directly to the pan with bacon or guanciale and mix with the rendered fat, allowing it to cool slightly.
original_subgoals: Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and add it to the pan with guanciale, allowing it to cool slightly.
Turn off the heat under the guanciale pan. Transfer the cooked pasta directly from the pot to the pan, including some pasta water to stop frying and start emulsifying.
Turn off the heat and leave about two tablespoons of bacon fat in the pan.
Add the drained spaghetti to the pan with bacon fat (heat off).
Transfer the cooked spaghetti directly from the pot to the pan with bacon.

subgoal: Create the sauce: add the egg and cheese mixture to the pasta, stirring quickly to combine and adding reserved pasta water as needed to achieve a creamy consistency.
original_subgoals: Mix the pasta with the egg mixture, ensuring the pasta is not too hot to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Stir until the sauce is creamy and coats the pasta.
Mix the pasta with the guanciale and fat, adding more pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce through emulsification.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pasta, tossing to combine and create a creamy texture without scrambling the eggs.
Add a small amount of reserved pasta water to the egg yolk and cheese mixture to help melt the cheese.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot spaghetti.
Mix the spaghetti with the bacon and then add the egg yolk and cheese mixture.
Toss the spaghetti gently to coat it with the egg mixture, allowing the heat from the pasta to cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce.
If the sauce is too thick, add a little reserved pasta water to loosen it.
Stir quickly to combine, adding more pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce.

subgoal: Finish and serve: garnish with additional black pepper, grated cheese, and crispy bacon or guanciale pieces.
original_subgoals: Serve with additional grated parmesan or pecorino and a touch of pepper for decoration.
Finish with additional cracked black pepper and a sprinkle of pecorino romano cheese before serving.
Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated Parmigiano Reggiano and crispy bacon pieces.
Finish with additional black pepper and grated pecorino or parmesan cheese.
